citation.article-title: Bacillus oleronius sp.nov., a member of the hindgut flora of the termite Reticulitermes santonensis (Feytaud).

p.s: Bacillus oleronius (o.le.ro'ni.us, is named oleronius for the island ile d'Oléron (France), the place where the host thrives)
Motile. 3-10 μm in length and 0.6-0.8 μm thick.
Double-layered cell wall composed of a murein sacculus and an S-layer.
Raised opaque colonies with erose to lobate margins with a diameter of ca. 3 mm after 2 days on tryptic soy agar.
The biochemical and physiological characteristic are compiled in Tables 1-3, and the sequence of the 16S rRNA has the accession number X82492 (EMBL Data Library).
The type strain is B. oleronius Rt 10 (DSM 9356).

Taxonomic comments: B. oleronius Rt 10 is related to species of the B. firmus-lentus group. B. oleronius Rt 10 could be distinguished from B. lentus and B. firmus and other described species of the B.firmus-lentus group by the sequence of its 16S rRNA and by the utilization of D-galacturonate, D-lyxose, L-lyxose, D-tagatose, tartronate, diaminopimelate, and phenylglycine and the hydrolysis of p-nitrophenyl-N-acetyl-α-D-glucosaminide and L-proline-p-nitroanilide.
The 16S rRNA sequence has a similarity value of 95.6 and 95.5 with B. fentus and B. firmus, respectively.
